image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives
image.name: S001101_002

profileText: a Representative from Texas; born in Wharton, Tex., September 15, 1955; attended public schools; graduated from Wharton High School, Wharton, Tex., 1974; B.A., University of Texas, 1978; attended University of Texas School of Law, 1979-1981; staff, United States Senator John Tower, 1977-1978; staff, Texas Governor John B. Connally, 1979-1980; director of administrative operations at the White House, 1981-1983; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 1985-January 3, 1989); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1988 to the One Hundred First Congress; died on July 21, 2024, in Honolulu, Hawaii.

researchRecord.name: 1988, 4 commercials on 3 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during David Sweeney's campaign for the 1988 U.S. congressional election in District 14 of Texas, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
